intro: Anagallidium rubrostriatum, commonly known as the red-striated sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in open habitats such as dunes or coastal areas. Its leaves are linear and often have a slight reddish tinge, contributing to its striking appearance. Anagallidium rubrostriatum is a perennial species that thrives in temperate climates and is often found in regions with mild winters and dry summers.
